title: Did the United States have a $500 billion deficit with China in 2017?
text: President Donald Trump put pressure on Beijing by declaring tariffs on imported Chinese goods worth up to $60 billion. For a long time, Trump has been whining about the US trade deficit with China, promising as a candidate to use import taxes to rearrange trade arrangements along what is believed to be more reciprocal lines. "Last year we lost $500 billion on trade with China," said Trump on March 23rd, said a press conference. "We can't let that happen." The trade balance of a country is simply the difference between the value of its imports and exports, and a trade deficit occurs when imports exceed exports.
